title: BlancoViz
text: A full-stack web application with a frontend website and a backend API. The frontend communicates with the backend API to perform full CRUD functionality. This was my first time working with both a database and an API.

title: Sorrybox
text: A client project built to help young children learn how to say sorry in a fun and supportive way. I developed an AI-powered chatbot that kids can talk to, along with other features to make the website more engaging.

title: Shift Festival
text: This group project was developed with fellow students, where I focused on the festival’s design. I contributed to shaping the concept, creating the posters, and designing the website’s visual identity.

title: Cortex Connect
text: My project is an interactive 3D brain model connected with ESP32 sensors to a React and Three.js web application. It is still in development, and it is my first experience combining hardware, WiFi communication, and a web app.

title: PalettePilot
text: A React application that helps designers extract color palettes from images. Users can drag and drop images or links onto a canvas, automatically generate swatches, and save them for later use. The project is still under construction, starting with core drag-and-drop and palette extraction before expanding to accessibility checks and design exports.

title: FlowBoard
text: An Angular app with an interactive Kanban board where tasks can be created, moved between columns (To Do, In Progress, Done), and deleted via drag & drop. The project is still under construction, starting with wireframes and a Figma prototype before comparing with the live Angular version.
